evidence: the Cauchy-Schwarz inequality guarantees that this similarity value will always lie between zero and one
the inner product of two vectors is always less than or equal to the product of their lengths
we represent each image as a vector in a high-dimensional space
structural similarity is essentially the normalized inner product between those two vectors
one is just a scaled version of the other

concepts.term: mathematical reason why the structural comparison term works

evidence: The Cauchy-Schwarz inequality is the mathematical reason why the structural comparison term works.
